Package net.xqhs.util.logging

Class Unit

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xqhs.util.config.Config
      • net.xqhs.util.logging.Unit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    net.xqhs.util.config.Configurable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    UnitComponent, UnitExt
    public class Unit
extends net.xqhs.util.config.Config
    The Unit class should be extended by classes in which logging primitives should be available without creating a specific object for logging. I.e. it will be possible to call primitives directly (e.g. le(message);). Logging primitives will be protected.

    It is characterized by the unitName, which also gives the name of the log. If the configured name is null, but the instance overrides the getDefaultUnitName() method, then the value returned by that method will be used. If the name is null and there is no override of getDefaultUnitName(), no log will be created and the elements in the configuration will be of no effect. If the name is DEFAULT_UNIT_NAME, the name of the class will be used. In any other case, the given unit name will be used and the log name will be computed accordingly -- will be the equal to the unit name or, if setUnitName(String, boolean, boolean) is called, the name of the class will be added.

    The actual LogWrapper instance is created when a logging message is posted, when an output is added, or when the buildLog() method is called.

    Although not abstract, the Unit cannot be used as a member of a class, as no logging functions are available publicly. This purpose is fulfilled by UnitComponent.

    Unit only offers the reduced ('simple') set of primitives specified by the Logger interface. It does not implement the interface however, as that would require the methods to become public.

    For the "classic" logging methods names, use UnitExt.

    The class extends Config, so extending classes can use the features offered by Config. In order not to interfere with the functionality of extending classes, the Unit never Config.lock()s the configuration. This class implements a lockedR() method with the same role as Config.locked(), but which transforms the Config.ConfigLockedException into an error message in the log.

    The sole purpose of the Unit layer of an instance is to handle logging.

    Author:
    Andrei Olaru

        public static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_UNIT_NAME
        The value that should be used to state that the name of the unit should be computed depending on the class name.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • unitName

        java.lang.String unitName
        The name of the Unit. See Unit for details.

      • logName

        java.lang.String logName
        The name that will be given to the log, may be the same with unitName, if that one is not null. See Unit for details.

      • ensureNew

        boolean ensureNew
        If true, then if another log exists with the same name, an error will be produced. If false and another log with the same name exists, that log will be used.

        Note: this functionality is not currently implemented.

      • level

        Logger.Level level
        The current level of the log. This may be influenced by the level of parent unit.

      • performanceMode

        boolean performanceMode
        Enables performance mode for this log.

      • properLevel

        Logger.Level properLevel
        The level that has been explicitly set by a setLogLevel(Level) call for this instance.

      • highlighted

        boolean highlighted
        A highlighted unit will produce messages shown differently from units which are not highlighted.

      • loggerWrapperType

        LogWrapper.LoggerType loggerWrapperType
        The type of the logging wrapper that will be used.

      • parentUnits

        java.util.Set<Unit> parentUnits
        The parent units, which may influence the log level or highlighting.

      • childrenUnits

        java.util.Set<Unit> childrenUnits
        The units having this unit as parent.

        LogWrapper log
        The LogWrapper that will be used for logging.

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultUnitName

        protected java.lang.String getDefaultUnitName()
        This method is meant to be overridden in inheriting classes, so as to give the default name for units of that type. It is meant to not be static, but the particular implementation in Unit is not dynamic.

        This member offers a simpler way to give the default unit name, by reinitializing it. It also offers a simple switch to switch the log level to the default level.

        WARNING: making this dynamic (return different values at different times) is useless; the method will be called only when the unit is constructed and the name returned will remain set.

        Returns:
        the default unit name for an instance of this class

      • lockedR

        public boolean lockedR()
        Calls the Config.locked() method and if an exception is thrown it posts an error message to the log.
        Returns:
        true if the configuration was locked, false otherwise.

      • buildLog

        protected Unit buildLog()
        Constructs a Unit according to the previously given parameters. More precisely, creates the log, according to the current configuration.
        Returns:
        the unit itself.

      • setUnitName

        protected Unit setUnitName​(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the name of the unit (and therefore of the log). See Unit for details on naming.
        Parameters:
        name - - the desired name of the unit
        Returns:
        the instance itself

      • setUnitName

        protected Unit setUnitName​(java.lang.String name,
                           boolean postfix,
                           boolean useLongClassName)
        Sets the name of the unit (and therefore of the log). See Unit for details on naming.

        In this version of the method, the name of the class will be present in the name of this log, also according to the other parameters.

        Parameters:
        name - - the desired name of the unit
        postfix - - if true, the name of the class will be concatenated after the name of the unit; otherwise, before
        useLongClassName - - if true, the complete name of the class will be used (including the package). Otherwise, only the name obtained by Class.getSimpleName() is used.
        Returns:
        the instance itself

      • setUnitName

        private Unit setUnitName​(java.lang.String name,
                         boolean addClassName,
                         boolean postfix,
                         boolean useLongClassName)
        Aggregates parameters from the two other version of the method. See Unit and the calling methods for details.
        Parameters:
        name - - the configured name of the unit.
        addClassName - - if true, the name of this class will be added to the name of the log.
        postfix - - if true, the name of the class will be added after the name of the unit; if false, it will be added before.
        useLongClassName - - if true, the canonical name of the class will be used (returned by getCanonicalName() ; if false, the simple name (returned by getSimpleName() ).
        Returns:
        the instance itself.

      • makeClassName

        private java.lang.String makeClassName​(boolean classNameLong)
        Gets the name of the current class, using either the canonical name or the simple name, depending on the argument.
        Parameters:
        classNameLong - - if true, the canonical name is used; the simple name otherwise.
        Returns:
        the name of the class.

      • setLogEnsureNew

        protected Unit setLogEnsureNew()
        If called, when the log is created, if another log exists with the same name, an error will be produced. Otherwise, if another log with the same name already exists, that log will be used.

        Note: this functionality is not currently implemented.

        Returns:
        the instance itself.

      • setLoggerType

        protected Unit setLoggerType​(LogWrapper.LoggerType loggerType)
        Sets the type of the logging infrastructure and wrapper used by this unit.
        Parameters:
        loggerType - - the type of logging infrastructure, as one of LogWrapper.LoggerType.
        Returns:
        the instance itself.

      • setLogLevel

        protected Unit setLogLevel​(Logger.Level logLevel)
        Sets the level (and also its proper level) of the log, as one of Logger.Level. Messages below this level will not be shown in the output.
        Parameters:
        logLevel - - the level.
        Returns:
        the instance itself.

      • setLogLevelInternal

        void setLogLevelInternal​(Logger.Level logLevel)
        Used internally to set the log level without changing the proper level. This is meant to be called by parent units to change the level when the parent changes level.
        Parameters:
        logLevel - - the level.

      • setHighlighted

        protected Unit setHighlighted()
        Sets this log as highlighted. THe exact method of highlighting depends on the implementation of the LogWrapper.
        Returns:
        the unit itself.

      • addParentUnit

        protected Unit addParentUnit​(Unit parent)
        Creates a link between this unit and a parent unit. The parent unit may influence the level and the highlighting.

        By default, all units have the MasterLog internal log as parent.

        Parameters:
        parent - - the parent Unit.
        Returns:
        the unit itself.

      • removeAllParentUnits

        protected Unit removeAllParentUnits()
        Removes all links to parent units.
        Returns:
        the unit itself.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the child had nod been registered before.

        Internal method to remove the link between a unit and its child.

        Returns:

      • addOutput

        protected Unit addOutput​(net.xqhs.util.logging.output.LogOutput logOutput)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the unit itself.
        See Also:

      • removeOutput

        protected Unit removeOutput​(net.xqhs.util.logging.output.LogOutput logOutput)
        Removes a log output.

        There is no effect if the log has not been built or has been already destroyed.

        Parameters:
        logOutput - - the output to remove.
        Returns:
        the unit itself.

      • removeAllOutputs

        protected Unit removeAllOutputs()
        Removes all outputs of the log.

        There is no effect if the log has not been built or has been already destroyed.

        Returns:
        the unit itself.

      • getUnitName

        protected java.lang.String getUnitName()
        This method is only accessible inside the instance, except if for good reasons an extending class makes it public.
        Returns:
        the Unit name, as given to or set in the constructor.

      • doExit

        protected void doExit()
        Instructs the Unit to exit. This method is only accessible inside the instance, except if for good reasons an extending class makes it public.

        As the Unit layer only manages logging, the only thing that happens is that the log exits (if any).

      • le

        protected void le​(java.lang.String message,
                  java.lang.Object... arguments)
        Post an error message. See Logger.
        Parameters:
        message - : the message to display
        arguments - : arguments to insert into the message. See Logger.le(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...).

        arguments - : arguments to insert into the message. See Logger.li(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...).

      • lf

        protected void lf​(java.lang.String message,
                  java.lang.Object... arguments)
        Post a tracing message. See Logger.
        Parameters:

        arguments - : arguments to insert into the message. See Logger.lf(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...).

      • lr

        protected java.lang.Object lr​(java.lang.Object ret)
        This method should be used in return statements. It adds a log message just before returning the Object in the argument, displaying the Object. See Logger.lr(java.lang.Object).
        Parameters:
        ret - : the Object to return.
        Returns:
        the Object passed as argument.

      • lr

        protected java.lang.Object lr​(java.lang.Object ret,
                              java.lang.String message,
                              java.lang.Object... arguments)
        This method should be used in return statements. It adds a log message just before returning the Object in the argument. See Logger.

        The Object in the argument is also put in the log message.

        Parameters:
        ret - : the Object to return and to display. Logger.Level.TRACE will be used.
        message - : the message to display beside the Object.
        arguments - : arguments to insert into the message. See Logger.lr(java.lang.Object).
        Returns:
        the Object passed as argument.

      • ler

        protected boolean ler​(boolean ret,
                      java.lang.String message,
                      java.lang.Object... arguments)
        This method should be used in return statements for error cases. It adds an error log message just before returning the value in the first argument. See Logger.
        Parameters:
        ret - : the value to return.
        message - : the message to display. Logger.Level.ERROR will be used.
        arguments - : arguments to insert into the message. See Logger.ler(boolean, java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...).
        Returns:
        the Object passed as argument.

      • dbg

        protected void dbg​(Debug.DebugItem debug,
                   java.lang.String message,
                   java.lang.Object... arguments)
        This method displays a log message (with the level TRACE) only if the specified Debug.DebugItem is activated. See Logger.
        Parameters:
        debug - : the Debug.DebugItem
        message - : the log message
        arguments - : arguments to insert into the message. See Logger.

      • l

        protected void l​(Logger.Level messageLevel,
                 java.lang.String message,
                 java.lang.Object... arguments)
        This method calls the underlying logging infrastructure to display a message with the specified level, text, and parameter objects.
        Parameters:
        messageLevel - - the level of the message.
        message - - the text of the message.
        arguments - - the objects to be inserted in the placeholders of the message text (see Logger).

      • compose

        protected static java.lang.String compose​(java.lang.String message,
                                          java.lang.Object[] objects)
        Composes a message with an array of Object instances. All apparitions of Logger.ARGUMENT_PLACEHOLDER will be replaced with results of calls to the toString() methods of objects, surrounded by Logger.ARGUMENT_BEGIN and Logger.ARGUMENT_END. Remaining objects will be displayed after the message.
        Parameters:
        message - : the message text.
        objects - : the objects.
        Returns:
        the assembled string.

      • getLogger

        protected LoggerClassic getLogger()
        Use this method to obtain a Logger instance which relays all calls directly to this Unit instance. This should be done when a Unit needs to expose its logger to some other instance.
        Returns:
        a LoggerClassic instance that exposes the logging methods of this Unit.
